function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential misinformation on COVID-19 transmission and risk factors related to climate and geography","Impact":"Misleading information about climate influence on disease spread can cause individuals to underestimate risk and fail to take necessary precautions","Mitigation":"Ensure accurate and up-to-date information on disease transmission and risk factors is communicated to the public","Technologies":"Data analytics and visualization tools to track and present accurate information","People":"General public, public health authorities, policymakers","Owner":"Public health organizations, government agencies"},{"Description":"Unsubstantiated conclusions on the impact of heat and sunlight on SARS-CoV-2 transmission","Impact":"False assumptions about the impact of heat and sunlight could lead to complacency and inadequate implementation of public health measures","Mitigation":"Conduct further research to understand the precise mechanisms of heat and sunlight on SARS-CoV-2 transmission","Technologies":"Biological and environmental science research tools and methods","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, climate scientists","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Relying on seasonal variations to contain SARS-CoV-2 spread","Impact":"Overreliance on seasonal variations could lead to neglect of other critical public health measures, allowing for continued transmission of the virus","Mitigation":"Implement comprehensive public health strategies that consider all potential transmission routes and factors, regardless of seasonal variations","Technologies":"Epidemiological modeling and simulation tools, public health data management systems","People":"Public health authorities, policymakers, healthcare professionals","Owner":"Public health organizations, government agencies"}]}
